item.title: Assembly
item.description: Unless otherwise specified I use the Intel syntax. My assembler of choice is NASM but sometimes I might also use yasm, which is quite similar. Hello world in Linux This is a minimal hello world program in Linux. It doesn’t need to link any external libraries. SECTION .text global _start ; "global" means that the symbol can be accessed in other modules. In order to refer to a global symbol from another module, you must use the "extern" keyboard _start: mov eax, 4 ; syscall: write mov ebx, 1 ; stdout mov ecx, msg mov edx, msgLen syscall mov eax, 1 ; syscal: exit mov ebx, 0 ; return code syscall msg: db "hello",10 msgLen: equ $ - msg ; the $ sign means the current byte address.
